battleship

Class Battleship

  • java.lang.Object
    • battleship.Battleship

  • public class Battleship
extends java.lang.Object
    Battleship class which contains methods
    Version:
    1.0 Name(s) and ID(s) Seungwoo Kim, 40000230 COMP249 Assignment # Assignment 1 Due Date September 22, 2017

      Constructor and Description
      Battleship()
      Once game board is set, it will ask to user to put desired coordinate with player(); And it will generate computer's coordinate.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void computerPositionGenerate()
      Similar use of Player() but there is no keyboard input Takes random coordinates and it will locate if the place is not taken.
      private void computerTurn()
      This method is for computer's turn and generate random position and determine shooting result and show.
      private void humanTurn()
      This method is used for player's turn.
      private void launchingGame()
      launchingGame method will launch a game and continue the game until there is no more ship is left for player or computer It will start from player's turn and continue to computer turn unless no one hit the grenade If someone hit the grenade, next turn will be skipped When the game is done, it will show the ending message with result board.
      private void player()
      Prompt user to enter input which desired coordinate.
      private void printingResult()
      At the end of the game, it will show you where the ships and grenades located in a game board.
      private void printingWholeBoard()
      Show the entire board (only called position) during the game.
      private Battleship.Shooting shoot(Grid a)
      This method will classify enumerated types case by case.
      private void shootResult(Battleship.Shooting b, Grid a) 
      private boolean stringToPosition(java.lang.String input)
      This method will change string to position of row and column Column is character in range between A to H so subtracting 'A' will get 0 to 7 range Row is integer in range between 1 to 8 but it is value of character so subtracting '1' will get 0 to 7 range
      private boolean verifyPosition(int column, int row)
      This method will verify if entered position was valid in range between 0 to 7

    • Constructor Detail

      • Battleship

        public Battleship()
        Once game board is set, it will ask to user to put desired coordinate with player(); And it will generate computer's coordinate. And it will begin the game.

    • Method Detail

      • player

        private void player()
        Prompt user to enter input which desired coordinate. If user enter invalid input, it will start again. stringToPosition will verify if the length of String is 2 or not and if it's correct, it will convert to integer. verifyPosition will verify if each of Character and Integer was in range or not. if all correct, they will be stored positionChar and positionInt and these will be a position in Array of Grid in its position.

      • computerPositionGenerate

        private void computerPositionGenerate()
        Similar use of Player() but there is no keyboard input Takes random coordinates and it will locate if the place is not taken.

      • launchingGame

        private void launchingGame()
        launchingGame method will launch a game and continue the game until there is no more ship is left for player or computer It will start from player's turn and continue to computer turn unless no one hit the grenade If someone hit the grenade, next turn will be skipped When the game is done, it will show the ending message with result board.

      • stringToPosition

        private boolean stringToPosition(java.lang.String input)
        This method will change string to position of row and column Column is character in range between A to H so subtracting 'A' will get 0 to 7 range Row is integer in range between 1 to 8 but it is value of character so subtracting '1' will get 0 to 7 range
        Parameters:
        input - this input is what user entered
        Returns:
        boolean is returned. If entered string's length is incorrect, it will return false, otherwise it will return true

      • verifyPosition

        private boolean verifyPosition(int column,
                               int row)
        This method will verify if entered position was valid in range between 0 to 7
        Parameters:
        column - row of game board
        row - column of game board
        Returns:
        Boolean is returned. If entered out of range, return false. Otherwise, it will return true

      • humanTurn

        private void humanTurn()
        This method is used for player's turn. It will ask user to enter the position If it's invalid position, while loop will continue until valid position is entered. If valid position is entered, it will determine shooting result and show. Once the turn is done, boolean humanTrueTurn becomes false.

      • computerTurn

        private void computerTurn()
        This method is for computer's turn and generate random position and determine shooting result and show. Once the turn is done, boolean humanTrueTurn becomes false.

      • printingWholeBoard

        private void printingWholeBoard()
        Show the entire board (only called position) during the game. Please also check method printGrid in Grid class

      • printingResult

        private void printingResult()
        At the end of the game, it will show you where the ships and grenades located in a game board.

      • shoot

        private Battleship.Shooting shoot(Grid a)
        This method will classify enumerated types case by case.
        Parameters:
        a - grid which respends
        Returns:
        enum Shooting is returned by case

      • shootResult

        private void shootResult(Battleship.Shooting b,
                         Grid a)
        Parameters:
        a - Grid a which respond
        b - Shooting emun actions by shoot result Shooting result is classified from enumerated type.
